solution.text:
Let the amount that Sarika paid be denoted by the variable t
Let the amount that Sheetal paid be denoted by the variable u
The statement tells us that Sarika paid _{k}_ times less than Sheetal did.
Therefore, we can infer that t is _{k}_ times less than u. Or, in other words : t = \(\frac {u}{_{k}_}\)
\(\implies\) u = _{k}_ t

content.text: Sarika paid _{k}_ times less than Sheetal for her train tickets to Mumbai. (Assume the amount that Sarika paid to be Rs.t and the amount that Sheetal paid to be Rs.u)
